Were in an unbelievably exciting area of tech and are fundamentally reshaping the data storage industry. Here, you lead with innovative thinking, grow along with us, and join the smartest team in the industry.
This type of workwork that changes the worldis what the tech industry was founded on. So, if you're ready to seize the endless opportunities and leave your mark, come join us.SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...
As a Product Configuration Analyst (PCA) you will be at the forefront of driving seamless product lifecycle and configuration management across hardware, software, and manufacturing domains. You will collaborate with cross-functional teamsincluding Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Quality, and Vendorsto maintain accurate Bills of Materials (BOMs), oversee changes, and implement best practices in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM). Your leadership will ensure data integrity, operational excellence, and alignment with organizational goals and regulatory requirements throughout the product lifecycle.
In this role, you will define and uphold processes for effective data management, configuration control, and BOM governance, guiding teams through new product introductions, engineering changes, and ongoing product iterations. Serving as the link between internal and external stakeholders, you will champion PLM system adoption, conduct audits, track metrics, and proactively resolve issues. With a focus on continuous improvement, you will balance technical expertise and strategic leadership to optimize product development and delivery.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

Oversee PLM activities, including BOM creation, maintenance, and updates for new and existing products.
Coordinate the end-to-end change management process, ensuring alignment among Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Quality.
Define and maintain best practices for data integrity, regulatory compliance, and configuration management across multiple platforms.
Drive cross-functional collaboration to ensure accurate and timely release of product documentation, specifications, and engineering change orders.
Manage and refine PLM workflows and user permissions, providing training and support to internal stakeholders.
Conduct data audits, analyze metrics, and develop process improvements to enhance efficiency and maintain high-quality standards.
Facilitate effective communication with vendors and international teams, ensuring global alignment on product lifecycle management practices.
Create, maintain, and update standard operating procedures, training materials, and user guides related to PLM and configuration management.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THIS ROLE:

Excellent verbal and written communications skills; presentation, customer service, business, and negotiation skills.
Ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization.
Effective leadership skills needed to manage cross-functional teams successfully.
Hands on experience with Agile, SAP, and/or Oracle bill of material, including a strong background in understanding complex product structures.
Ability to be successful in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities.
Broad understanding of Pures products and services technologies is highly desired.
Configure the Marketing SKUs with HW BOMs & SW granularity.
Manage SKU level life cycle: create new SKUs prior to pilot, release them to production, and manage throughout their lifecycle to EOL.
Set up Product BOMs based on manufacturing strategy such as CTO, PTO, BTO, FRU, etc.
Work effectively with staff to VP level employees within the function, across functions and with external parties.
Operate and drive results and set priorities independently, be a proactive contributor and subject matter expert.
Demonstrate favorable results through regular leadership and influencing others.

Requirements:

8+ years of experience with Bachelor of Arts or Science degree (or equivalent experience)
8+ years of experience in configuration management within a technical (hardware, software, or manufacturing) environment.
Strong familiarity with PLM systems (e.g., Agile, Arena, Teamcenter, or Oracle Cloud) and CAD/PDM tools (e.g., SolidWorks PDM).
Demonstrated understanding of BOM structures, engineering change processes, and cross-functional data integration.
Proven ability to manage complex projects, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced setting.
Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the capacity to influence and collaborate across diverse teams and stakeholders.
Analytical mindset, adept at auditing, interpreting metrics, and driving continuous improvement initiatives.
Preferred experience with ERP/MRP systems, JIRA/Confluence, and compliance frameworks (e.g., ISO, GMP, RoHS, REACH).

....Do you lie awake at night, thinking of NIST SP800-63-3? Do you get shivers when you hear the words service account? Does zero trust actually mean something to you? As they say, Identity is the new perimeter, and it could be your new frontier here at Pure Storage.
The Global Information Security Office (GISO) at Pure is seeking a Technical Project Manager to coordinate key initiatives within our Identity and Access Management (IAM) program. This role will be responsible for planning, executing, and delivering IAM projects across the enterprise, ensuring alignment with business objectives, security standards, and compliance requirements.
The ideal candidate will have experience managing IT and security projects, supporting the execution of cross-functional IAM and security projects, and understands IAM principles such as identity lifecycle management, authentication, authorization, role-based access control, privileged access, and governance. There will be opportunities for growth while working with peers in other project management groups.
Responsibilities:

Lead end-to-end project management for IAM initiatives, including but not limited to identity lifecycle automation, SSO/MFA rollouts, role-based access control (RBAC), IGA platform implementations, and PAM integrations.
Partner with IAM architects and engineers to translate technical solutions into executable project plans.
Define scope, schedule, milestones, deliverables, and resource needs for multiple concurrent IAM projects.
Maintain detailed project documentation including roadmaps, risk logs, status reports, and change requests.
Coordinate with stakeholders across IT, Security, HR, Compliance, and business units to gather requirements and ensure smooth project execution.
Monitor progress and manage risks, issues, and dependencies to ensure timely and within-budget delivery.
Ensure IAM projects align with enterprise security policies, compliance requirements (e.g., SOX, NIST), and zero trust strategies.
Support vendor management and third-party integration efforts for IAM tools.
Drive adoption of IAM governance frameworks, processes, and standards.

WHAT YOULL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...

5+ years of project management experience in IT or security programs.
Fundamental understanding of IAM concepts such as identity provisioning, SSO, MFA, RBAC, PAM, and IGA.
Proven track record managing cross-functional technical projects in enterprise environments.
Proficient in project management tools such as Jira, Smartsheet, Asana, or MS Project.
Strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Experience with waterfall and agile methodologies.
Interest in obtaining PMP, PMI-ACP, or equivalent project management certification.
Technical background in systems, cloud, or IAM engineering a plus.
Ability to manage competing priorities and drive alignment across technical and business teams.
Detail-oriented, highly accountable, and results-driven.
Passion for improving process maturity and enabling secure digital transformation.

We are primarily an in-office environment and therefore, you will be expected to work from the Santa Clara, CA office in compliance with Pures policies, unless you are on PTO, or work travel, or other approved leave.
